DataElement.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure First-Line Platinum-Based Chemotherapy Cycle Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Number of therapeutic cycles of the preferred standard chemotherapy that is derived from or containing platinum and used as treatment for a particular condition to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure First-Line Therapy Platinum-Based Chemotherapy Cycle
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Therapeutic cycle of the preferred standard chemotherapy that is derived from or containing platinum and used as treatment for a particular condition to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: The preferred standard treatment for a particular condition.:Derived from or containing platinum.:The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.:An event or sequence of events that constitute a round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence.

Concepts.definition: The preferred standard treatment for a particular condition.
The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.
An event or sequence of events that constitute a round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:An event or sequence of events that constitute a round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
An event or sequence of events that constitute a round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
